turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Look, Jimmy, you know, I haven't seen you in eight years, you show up to my door like you're on drugs - now the least you could do is tell me what the fuck is going on!

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: And?...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I killed them.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Oh, shit, shit, shit - I don't know about all this! You sure?!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah I'm sure!  I did it with my own hands!

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Jimmy, do you realize what you did? Man that's like death penalty shit -

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It was self-defense, Tubbs! They're dirty!  I walked in on something, I don't know what -

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: You gotta turn yourself in. Before it's too late -

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: They're inside the department, they're everywhere - it's not safe.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Shit, you know what happens to me if I'm harboring a fugitive?  I already think they're on to me! I thought you were the phone police for Chrissake!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I have nowhere else to go, Tubbs, I need your help!

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Oh man...what happened?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I don't know.  But I'm in trouble. I'm all over the papers. I have to figure out what's going on.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Alright...alright...you've saved my ass enough times.  What do you want to do?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I hope you haven't lost your touch with this stuff.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Shit, what I have now made our setup in Angola look like Tinker Toys.  I've been skipping through Internal Revenue records all day. I even have video strip poker. You want to check it out?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I've got a better idea...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: OK...where do you want to start?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: OK, I'm logged on to the municipal network.  I'm showing sixteen people with the name Sarah Williams in L.A. county.  None of them live in Hollywood.  Do you remember the address?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: 1490...Breckinridge...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Let's see what we got...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Donut?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No thanks.  How do you know they can't catch you on this thing?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: I don't, but I'm pretty sure. It's a long story but I cloned a cellular linkup with a binary code scrambler and sent it through the phone network mainframe.  If they start a trace it will be to a Pic'n'Save on Pico.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I knew I could count on you.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: I got a lot of free time, you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: OK...county tax records...they're saying 1490 Breckinridge is owned by... an Atlantic Trust Corporation...they have a P.O. box in D.C.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: How about Marvosa and the others?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: I'll access the LAPD mainframe, but we gotta be careful - that one's kind of tricky -

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: So...what happened to you, Jimmy?  I figure you'd be in some far off place somewhere, living on the edge like the good old days.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I gave all that up.  I got tired of the lies. They wanted to stuff me in Levenworth to cover their asses on a botched assignment.  It got so I didn't know who to trust anymore...  ...some things never change, I guess.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: You know this time, there's nobody that's gonna cover your ass. You're over your head this time.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What else is new?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: OK...Marvosa makes calls to this fax number overseas.  And that's Switzerland's country code.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: A bank?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Who knows?  Maybe he's ordering army knives. I can't access that, but look what we have here...these are the account records for Fleming and Marvosa.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Both at the same bank...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: And look at the balances...these aren't police salaries...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Ahh, shit.  We're pretty much tapped out.  I'm getting denied access all over the place...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It's not very much to go on...is there anything else we can check?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Shit, we just started.  But I better log out of this.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: That was her - the girl... We have to go.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: I'm not going anywhere!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Tubbs, these people mean business.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: I told you I'm not going anywhere! I got my whole life in this place!  I'll just destroy the evidence and play dumb.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: I can't help you anymore, Jimmy. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I'm going to need a way to get there.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Are you going to be alright?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Don't worry about me...  ...and don't forget your helmet. You don't want to get a ticket.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well I've kind of had my fill of the place, you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: You must be going somewhere.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I don't have any real destination. I'm just going South.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Mind if I come along for the ride?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I'm stranded out here.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hop in.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Where did you learn to fight like that? JIM  I read a book.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Well, you saved me from a bad situation. Thanks.  I admit this is...unusual.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Are you a regular there?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Are you serious?  My boyfriend ditched me...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Ditched you?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: We were fighting - I told him to let me out.  So where are you headed?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Bartender said there are motels south of here.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What would your - boyfriend - think?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Screw him!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You don't seem afraid of much.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Not with this...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No - that's not it!  She said her boyfriend stranded her up there! I didn't ask her to come with me!

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Did you have sex with her?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Did you have sexual intercourse with the woman in question?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No.  It wasn't like that!

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Then what did you do, play canasta?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Where am I going?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: County jail - get in.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Don't you guys ever knock?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Long gone... MARVOSA Well you won't mind if I don't take your word for it, right?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Long gone, huh?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: I asked him not to tell me where he was going.  I told him I don't want any part of it.

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Oh yeah?  You're a smart man?...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Yeah, and that's all I'm going to say. If you want to arrest me, go ahead...

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Nahhh...

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: What about him?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I need to ask you questions of a psychological nature.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Remember when you asked for a study on him, I refused. Same goes for now.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: That was Peterson upstairs.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: It was you who did the asking.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: He doesn't think you run mind games on him.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I wouldn't presume to try.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: You're never alone in a room with Graham, are you? You're smooth about it, but you're never one-on-one with him. Why's that? Do you think he's psychic?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: He's an eideteker. He has almost total recall.  But I don't think he's psychic.  What he has it empathy and projection.  He can assume your point of view and mine.., and some other points of view that scare and sicken him.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Why aren't you ever alone with him?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Because I'm professionally concerned about him. And he'd pick up on that. He's fast. He hates being prodded and poked.  So do I.  What do you want?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: His nervous breakdown followed Hobbs. Could he kill again if he had to save his life? Or would he hesitate?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I'll tell you the events. The psychology's none of your business. Hobbs was trying to cut his eleven- year-old daughter's throat. Graham shot him with his .38 six times. Hobbs still didn't go down. He had to wade in...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: That's when it happened?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: No. It happened when Graham went to see Hobbs' daughter four months later in the hospital. She saved her carotid artery.., but lost three fingers and her larynx. She was connected up to a voice box.  When Graham went to see her, she asked him -- through the speaker: 'Why did you have to kill my daddy?'  That's when Graham had his nervous breakdown.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: What's the bottom line?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: If he pushes too deep into our boy's mind-set, he may destroy himself.  What are you planning, Jack?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Could he handle a direct contact?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I don't recommend it.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Crawford has a proposition. I don't think it's a good idea.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: If the Tooth Fairy listens to Lecktor, he'll come for me. So we're going to set me up as bait to draw him out. Give him a clean shot.  That's what you were thinking, isn't it?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What have we missed?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: He may have an unconscious homosexual conflict. A fear of being gay. He objects to the word 'fairy.' Plus smeared bloodstains indicate that he put the shorts on Charles Leeds after he was dead.  I believe he did this to emphasize his lack of interest in Mr. Leeds.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Sidney: I don't understand him.  We know he re-arranges the kids and husbands into a dead audience.  To witness the act. We know he thinks the act is making him into something different. His 'becoming'... but I don't know what it is he thinks he's becoming.  The answer is something to do with how he uses the mirrors. That's what's missing for me.  Why the mirrors?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: The usual motivation doesn't apply to him, nor the way he uses them.  I don't have an answer for you.  Listen to me, my friend: leave this.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: And do what? Read about the next family in the morning paper?  In my Monkey Ward safehouse 'cause I can't take my family home?  This ends when I make it over.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: How are Molly and the boy?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Kevin and Molly are on their way to Montana.  Who the hell is he to do this to my family, Sidney? Answer me that...!

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: The main thing is: how was Lecktor to reply.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: That's probably in the part Lecktor tore out.  At the top it says: 'I hope we can correspond.' And then the hole begins.  It looks like Lecktor went over it with a felt tip pen and then folded it and pinched most of it away.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He doesn't have anything to cut with.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: In thirty-five minutes.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Christ!

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Then the Tooth Fairy named the book in the part Lecktor tore out.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Right.  What about sweating Lecktor?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: They tried sodium amytal on him three years ago to find where he buried a Princeton student.  He gave them a recipe for potato chip dip.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: It has to be a book the Tooth Fairy would know Lecktor has in his cell.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He'd know it from articles he's read about Lecktor...

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: How long do I have?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Twenty minutes max.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Aniline dyes in the inks in felt-tip pens -- which is what Lecktor has -- are transparent to infrared. The Tooth Fairy's ballpoint isn't...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: That could be the tip of a 't.  Here and here. And here.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: At the end is the tail of what could be an 'r.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: The Chicago office is running through all the personal ads in the Tattler right now.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: When do they go to press?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: If there's any doubt, we matched the indents of the bitemark on the note against the Smithsonian teeth. This is your boy...  He folded the bottom part, including what Lecktor tore out. In this enlargement of the back side, oblique light revealed impressions.  We can make out: 'six-six-six'.  I didn't spot it until I had this high-contrast print. I advised Chicago as soon as I saw it.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Issue the toilet paper tear as a...

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: No.  The numbers aren't right for a jailhouse alphabet code. It's a book code.  And your message has to go out in it, or he'll know it's not Lecktor talking to him.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Book code?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: 'One hundred prayers' could be the page number. The paired numbers and the scriptural references could be line and letter. But what book?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Not the Bible?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: No. Galatians 15:2? Galatians has only six chapters. The same with Jonah 6:8 -- Jonah has four chapters. Lecktor wasn't using a Bible.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Willingham, when he tossed his cell, took Polaroids so they could get everything back in place...

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Have him meet me with pictures of Lecktor's books...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Library of Congress.

turns.speaker: CHESTER
turns.text: This is Chester here. Who am I talking to?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Will Graham, Jack Crawford...

turns.speaker: CHESTER
turns.text: We got an ad order in tonight's "Tattler" with 'six-six-six' in it. It's being Telexed to you right now.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Read it.

turns.speaker: CHESTER
turns.text: 'Dear Pilgrim, you honor me.'

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: That's it. Lecktor called him a Pilgrim when he was talking to me...

turns.speaker: CHESTER
turns.text: 'You're very beautiful.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Whatever I say, you'll take him away, won't you?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I have to.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You're his friend, Jack. Why can't you leave him alone?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Because it's his bad luck to be special.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: He thinks you want him to look at evidence.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Nobody's better with evidence. But he has the other thing, too. He doesn't like that part of it...

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You wouldn't like it, either if you had it.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Talking about 'like,' you don't like me very much, do you?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: No.  I don't like people who park in the 'handicapped zone'...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I'll try to keep him as far away from it as I can...

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Let's go to bed. I'll rub your back.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I need to talk to you about Will Graham.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I should have caught you at the boat yard when you got off work. You don't want to talk about it here...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it anywhere.  If you brought pictures, leave them in the briefcase. Molly and Kevin will be back soon.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: How much do you know?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What was in the 'Miami Herald' and the 'Times.'  Confessions?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Eighty-six so far. All cranks. He smashes the mirrors and uses the pieces.  None of them knew that;

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What else did you keep out of the papers?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Blond, right-handed, really strong, wears a size eleven shoe. The prints are all smooth gloves. He's on a full moon cycle. Both times. His blood is AB Positive.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Somebody hurt him?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Typed him from semen. He's a secretor.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Will... you saw this in the papers. The second one was all over TV. Did you ever think about givin' me a call?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: The Bureau already has the best lab. Plus you have Bloom at the University of Chicago...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: And I got you down here fixing fuckin' boat motors.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: You don't need me. I wouldn't be useful to you anymore, Jack.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Last two like this we had, you caught.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: That was three years ago. And by doing the same things you and the rest of them at the lab are doing.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: That's not entirely true, Will. It's the way you think.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: I think there has been a lot of bullshit about the way I think.  I came down here to get away from all that.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: You look all right now.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: I am all right.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: If you can't look anymore, I understand...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: As long as they're dead...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: These are all dead, Will.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Let's talk after dinner. Stay and eat.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I'LL come back later. I got messages at the Holiday Inn to collect.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Jack, this is Graham. Is Price still in Latent Prints?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: He's working on the single print index. What time is it?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Get him to Atlanta.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: You said the guy down here is good.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He is good. Bur not as good as Price.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: What do you want to do?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Mrs. Leeds' fingernails and toenails. I think he took off his gloves, Jack.  And dust all the corneas of all their eyes.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: A cat. We found a litter box downstairs but not the cat.  Neighbors are watching for it.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Why don't you get Birmingham P.D. a methane probe out of D.C. and have them cover the backyard...  maybe the cat's dead and the kids buried it.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: ...snuck in the hospital while I was sedated, flipped back the sheets and shot pictures. The only decent thing he did was run a black square over my balls...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I know...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Atlanta and Birmingham can run the thumb print against known sex offenders. Five will get you ten they don't come up with an identification. Jimmie may in the Finder program... if he's ever been printed and in his Index.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Say we've arrested a good suspect. You walk in and see him. What is there about him that doesn't surprise you?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: I don't know, Jack. He's got no face for me.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: You can tell something about him or we wouldn't have found the finger print...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Don't expect too much from me, Jack, all right?  We'll get him one way or the other.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: What's one way?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: We find an event that connects both families. Same vacation hotel; same hospital, different times. Then we check employees and come up with a male nurse, hairdresser, whatever...  If we find out how he found them, then we'll find him.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: We're running it through the computers now. So far there's no event or service that doubles back into both families. Plus they were big consumers: snowmobiles, fishing trips, scuba, videogames, lots of routine medical and dental. It's a haystack.  What's the other?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He makes noise going in and the husband gets to a gun in time.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: No other possibilities?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: You think I'm gonna spot him 'across a crowded room?'  That's Ezio Pinza you're thinking about.  The Tooth Fairy will go on until we get smart or get lucky. He won't stop.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Because he has a genuine taste for it, Jack.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: See? You do know something about him.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: ...I'm going to see Lecktor.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: For Christ's sake, why?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: To recover the mind set.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Is it weird?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: The mark? Yes.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: If the Documents section can't do it... I'll send it up to Langley...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Did Price get anywhere with the single prints off the Leeds?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Who did he ask for?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: You.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: How'd you know 'broken mirrors?' Bribe a cop?  Tell it to the U.S. Attorney, Lounds!

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Sarah, order a chopper. I want the next thing smoking and I don't care whose. Ours. DCPD.  Or the Marines. Then call Documents. Tell them to scramble a team. I want everybody moving in five minutes.  Dr. Chilton, please do not handle the note. I have a Documents team on the way to you by helicopter to pick it up.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: After we've worked the note we want to replace it in Lecktor's cell. I don't want him to know we found it.  Where's Lector now?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: We know the Tooth Fairy reads the Tattler. The stuff about me and Lector? I don't know any other paper that carried it...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: ...there's three 't's' and an 'r' in Tattler.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Personal ads?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Twenty-five minutes. We won't make it in time.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: We let Lecktor's message run as is and decode it after. Or we pull it, work our the code and put ours in next week.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Can we still get Lecktor's message out of the paper?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Yes. And I'm leery of running Lecktor's message without knowing what it says.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: And if we pull it, we lose a week... We only have two to the next full moon.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: It's your call, Will. What do we do?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Run it.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: What if it encourages the Tooth Fairy to do something besides write?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: We will feel sick for a very long time.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Will, Bowman just broke the code. It was a James Beard cook book. You need to know what it says right now.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What'd it say?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I'll tell you in a second. Now listen to me: everything is okay, I'm taking care of it, so stay on the phone when I tell you.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Tell me now.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: It says: 'Graham home, 3860 DeSoto Highway, Marathon, Florida. Save yourself. Kill them all.  It's your home address, Will. The bastard gave him your home address.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Get me a plane...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Wait, Will...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Get me a plane!

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I'll pick you up in...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: I won't be here.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Asian studies at Langley said the mark you found on the tree is a Chinese character considered a positive or a lucky sign in gambling. The character also appears on a mah- jongg piece.  It means Red Dragon.  That mean anything to you?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: You got the message Lecktor called...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: I arranged for him to have a phone. I have to call him in a few minutes.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: From the lip wound, which happened seven hours before he got burned, we've narrowed it down to those cities within the seven-hour driving radius that also would've caught the 'Tattler' early Tuesday morning.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What's it narrow down to?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Milwaukee, Madison, Dubuque, Peoria, St. Louis, Indianapolis, Cincinnati, Toledo and Detroit.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: That's narrow?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: When are you coming back?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: When I'm done.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He changes them into beings that accept him... And he needs to see the acceptance, In the mirrors.  I didn't understand the mirrors before.  It's very important.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: 'Changes?'

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: It's a word. Killing them...  His delusion is: if he sees himself accepted enough times, he will become as one who has the power to be accepted all the time.  And he would record it somehow. So he can see himself received over and over again...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: VTR, film, Polaroid, stills, what?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: How do I know?!

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He's very careful, very... designed when he chooses.  If we find out how he finds them, then we'll find him.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: There's no connection between the families.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: There has to be.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: There is none! We've run it through the computer a dozen times.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He's a very shy boy...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Something Lecktor said.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Let's admit we struck out this month. The Gulf Stream's standing by. The basic lab stuff is on it.  You, Zeller, Jimmie Price, a photographer. Anywhere he hits, we can be there in an hour and fifteen minutes. We get the call, we roll. The scene'll be very fresh...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: It's not over yet.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: It's a foregone conclusion. For Christ's sake, it's eleven PM.  The full moon is tonight.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Will?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: You wanna watch this or what?!

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: That's why the boltcutter.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He used a boltcutter to trim the branch out of his way. When he was watching from the woods. Why didn't he use it to go through the basement door?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Because a steel door and deadbolt were there when they were killed.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: You mean Jacobi put it in between when this film was made and when he was murdered?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: He had to.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: It's getting late and...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Don't talk to me!!

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: It's the guard in the storeroom.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: We want the cans the Jacobi home movies came in.  They're in the far corner of the room under the windows.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: There's some film cans in the far corner of the room underneath one of the windows.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What it's going to say on the Jacobi film can is the same as it says on the Leeds' film can: Gateway Lab, St. Louis, Missouri.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Is there a label on the Jacobi can that says what lab processed it?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: No. It's Bob's Photo Store in...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Have him peel the top label back.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: See if there's another label underneath.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: It does, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I want a chopper on the roof in three minutes. To Meigs Field.  At Meigs have them warn up and flight- prep the Gulf Stream.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Parking permits...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Are your parking permits in the computer? He drives a van.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Fogel has four more names. He knows two: both dark hair. Third's a woman. Fourth's a handicapped parking permit...

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: This is our boy...!

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Will...?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: You're not going to need that. Because we're going in careful and slow and secure a perimeter and a St. Louis PD Swat team is going to take him. Not us.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Get the roadblocks set on Route Three! There's an access road to the back of the house. That ought to be a second team's approach.  Will Graham and I are in an orchard due west of the house.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: How far away's the back-up?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Three minutes.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: I'll cover the back.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Stay in the trees.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: There's somebody in the house, Jack...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Wait for the back-up! Will?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: It's happening again, Jack...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: ...but if we find him, the print as evidence will get a conviction, Hold on. What?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: He asked for Will. He said he might call back tonight. I tried to hold him... I'm sorry... He said 'tell Graham "broken mirrors."'

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Will. Get right back here. He just called.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Where the hell's Graham!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: He went to the men's room.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: For Christ's sake get him!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Let's get to the physical.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: ...twenty-eight minutes.  Cryptography at Langley?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: They got shot a Telex. They're on if now...

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Ms. McClain, I'm Francis Dollarhyde. I came about the low light level infrared film stock.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Put your back against the door. Come forward three steps until you feel the tile on your feet and there will be a stool just to your left.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Can you give me an idea of the conditions...

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Shooting at maybe eight feet. I can't use any lights.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: What's being photographed?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: The activities of nocturnal animals.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: When do you need it?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: In eight days.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Let me stick this in the black hole.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: The 1000 C Infrared Sensitive Film must be handled in total darkness. I keep the samples straight by touch code.  It's still easier to handle than a 1200 series. Think it'll do?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: It'll do fine.

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: I'll take you.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: No, thanks. I manage very well.  I'll order you twelve hundred feet: of 1000 C tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Ride with me.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Thanks, but I'll take the bus. I do it all the time.

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Dandridge is a condescending prick. Ride with me. It would be because I want you to.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Come on in.  How about a gin and tonic?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Tonic will be fine.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: In the kitchen.

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: How did you come to Gateway?

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: They had to shape up their employment practices to keep this defense contract.

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: You worked out well.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: You know you speak very well, although you avoid fricatives and sibilants in your speech. At the Riker Institute for the Blind. I trained in speech therapy for speech and hearing impaired children...

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: I'll probably go back to it someday.

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Ready to tell me what kind of 'outing' this is?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: It's a surprise.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: That was nice of you to think of that.

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: I made you a gin and tonic. It's by the side of the sofa...

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Is that you. D?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Yes, are you okay...?!

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Good morning...  If you show me where things are, I'll make us some coffee...

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: No! Don't go back into the house...  It's too nice outside.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: My sister's coming by to pick me up for brunch. Why don't you come, too?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: I have work to do at the plant.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: I'll get my purse.

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: I'll get it.  Stay right here. You look very good in the sun...

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Do you want a Coke or something, Reba?

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: I'm fine, Francis.

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Reba...

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Francis? Where are you?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: The developing room.  I need to... see you.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: I want to see you, too, Francis... Should I come over?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: No. Reba...?

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Are you okay...?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: I'll see you later. All right?

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: You'll come by?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: It's me.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Me.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Francis...?

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: Am I alone in this room? Are you here...  Why are you doing this?!

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Some remarkable events have happened in Birmingham and Atlanta.  Do you know what I'm talking about?

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Two groups of people were changed. Leeds and Jacobi. The police think they were murdered.  Do you know what they call the being that visited these people?  You can say.

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: The Tooth...

turns.speaker: REBA
turns.text: It's Dragon. Dragon... Red Dragon.

turns.speaker: DOLLARHYDE
turns.text: Francis did a thing for you today so I couldn't have you. And he was wrong.  I AM THE DRAGON!  Give me your hand.
